headline: Salesforce’s Benioff Apologizes for Pro-Trump National Guard Comments
summary: “Having listened closely to my fellow San Franciscans and our local officials, and after the largest and safest Dreamforce in our history, I do not believe the National Guard is needed to address safety in San Francisco,” Benioff wrote Friday in a post on social network X.  The Salesforce co-founder has faced backlash after saying in an interview with the New York Times that he “fully” supports Trump and that National Guard troops should be deployed to San Francisco.

headline: Salesforce is down 26% in 2025. What's next for AI agent giant?
summary: Salesforce (CRM) stock is down by nearly 26% year-to-date in 2025 as it deploys more agentic AI applications, CEO Marc Benioff saying that the agentic AI revolution "is going to be magic" at the 2025 Dreamforce conference. J.P. Morgan Asset Management global market strategist Stephanie Aliaga comments on Salesforce's business approach to AI agents, while Yahoo Finance senior reporter Ines Ferré discusses the tone of this year's Dreamforce event. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.
